other_tests.date: At the age of 4 months for patient III-1; after birth for patient III-2
other_tests.findings: Free T3 was low (0.83 pmol/liter; normal range, 2.2 –8.8 pmol/liter), free T4 was undetectable (normal range, 15 –30 ng/liter) for patient III-1; total T3 and T4 were diminished at 0.56 /H9262g/liter (normal range, 1.32 –3.71/H9262g/liter) and 24 /H9262g/liter (normal range, 89 –236/H9262g/liter) for patient III-2.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Under T4 substitution, fT3 and fT4 normalized rapidly for patient III-1; for patient III-2, T3 normalized to 1.93 /H9262g/liter and T4 to 117 /H9262g/liter, but TSH remained very low at 0.07 mU/liter.

other_tests.date: At a chronological age of 10 weeks

other_tests.procedure_name: Thyroid hormone levels assessment for patient III-3
other_tests.findings: fT3 was 1.7 pmol/liter (normal range, 2.2 –8.8 pmol/liter), fT4 was 2 ng/liter (normal range, 15 –30 ng/liter), TSH was 0.02 mU/liter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Under therapy with 50 /H9262g/d T4 since the second week of life, physical and mental development was normal.
